qas.question: The final investment decision for what was finalized by Royal Dutch Shell in May 2011?

answers.text: the world's first floating liquefied natural gas (FLNG) facility

qas.question: The remote offshore Prelude field was discovered where?
The Prelude field was estimated to contain how many cubic feet of natural gas reserves?
On what developments was FLNG technology based?

answers.text: the exploitation of untapped natural gas reserves located in remote areas

qas.question: When did Royal Dutch Shell make its first investment into FLNG?
What is located off Australia's southwestern coast?
When was the FLNG facility built?

context: On <b5_0>20 May 2011<b5_0/>, Royal Dutch Shell's final investment decision for <a0_0>the world's first floating liquefied natural gas (FLNG) facility<a0_0/> was finalized following the discovery of <b7_0>the remote offshore Prelude field<b7_0/>—located <a1_0>off <b8_0>Australia<b8_0/>'s northwestern coast<a1_0/> and estimated to contain about <a2_0>3 trillion<a2_0/> cubic feet of natural gas equivalent reserves—in <b9_0>2007<b9_0/>. FLNG technology is based on <a3_0>liquefied natural gas (LNG)<a3_0/> developments that were pioneered in the <b6_0>mid-20th century<b6_0/> and facilitates <a4_0>the exploitation of untapped natural gas reserves located in remote areas<a4_0/>, often too small to extract any other way.
